page.topic: Using a Query to Find a Record
page.description: The following script shows how a query works. First, we open a table and set the query dot variable parameters. In this case the default record order is fine. We only filter for records where the field Bill_State_Region equals "MA". Finally, we create the query list.

section.example: dim tbl as P dim qry as P dim nrecs as N tbl = table.open("customer") query.filter = "Bill_State_Region = 'MA'" qry = tbl.query_create()

section.description: The next two lines demonstrate that we can get the number of records in the query.
section.example: nrecs = qry.records_get() ui_msg_box("","The number of matching records is " + nrecs)

section.description: The next lines demonstrate how to loop through the records of the query list and process them.
section.example: tbl.fetch_first() ui_msg_box("", "The state is " + tbl.Bill_state_region) while .not. tbl.fetch_eof() ' do something interesting with the data tbl.fetch_next() wend

see.ref: Using an Index to Find a Record
